Class SFDCValidator

public class SFDCValidator

This class provides basic validation functionality for different types of input.
Note : we don't do any decoding before the checks because that really depends on the context used. Instead, we enforce strict input validation on the input as is.
Note : we expose almost every function in this class in two forms isValid and getValid. They work the same way internally. The only difference is that, the isValid will call the getValid internally, catch any exceptions, and return false in that case. So you can use which ever you prefer, it is only a style preference. the GetValid will always return the exact string as the input.

Method Detail

isValidCreditCard

public Boolean isValidCreditCard(String input,
                                           Boolean allowNull)
Calls getValidCreditCard and returns true if no exceptions are thrown.

getValidCreditCard

public String getValidCreditCard(String input,
                                           Boolean allowNull)
Returns the exact original input if all tests passed. Invalid input will generate an exception. This function will only validate Visa and MasterCard 16 digits credit cards.

Parameters:
input - The actual user input data to validate.
allowNull - If allowNull is true then an input that is NULL or an empty string will be legal. If allowNull is false then NULL or an empty String will throw an exception.
Returns:
Original input
Throws:
Exception

SFDC_isValidDate

public Boolean SFDC_isValidDate(String input,
                                          String format,
                                          Boolean allowNull)
Calls SFDC_getValidDate and returns true if no exceptions are thrown.

SFDC_getValidDate

public String SFDC_getValidDate(String input,
                                          String format,
                                          Boolean allowNull)
Returns the original input if it is a valid date. Invalid input will generate a descriptive exception. Uses RegEx patterns because Apex does not allow the user to choose which format he is going to use when setting the date/datetime objects.

Parameters:
input - The actual user input data to validate.
format - Required formatting of date inputed (In RegEx - some basic patterns can be found in the SFDCPatterns class).
allowNull - If allowNull is true then an input that is NULL or an empty string will be legal. If allowNull is false then NULL or an empty String will throw an exception.
Returns:
Original input
Throws:
Exception

isValidDouble

public Boolean isValidDouble(String input,
                                       Double minValue,
                                       Double maxValue,
                                       Boolean allowNull)
Calls getValidDouble and returns true if no exceptions are thrown.

getValidDouble

public Double getValidDouble(String input,
                                       Double minValue,
                                       Double maxValue,
                                       Boolean allowNull)
Returns a validated real number as a double. Invalid input will generate an exception.

Parameters:
input - The actual input data to validate.
allowNull - If allowNull is true then an input that is NULL or an empty string will be legal. If allowNull is false then NULL or an empty String will throw an exception.
minValue - Lowest legal value for input.
maxValue - Highest legal value for input.
Returns:
A validated real number as a double.
Throws:
Exception

                                       Long minValue,

getValidNumber

public Double getValidNumber(String input,
                                       Long minValue,
                                       Long maxValue,
                                       Boolean allowNull)
Returns a validated number as a double within the range of minValue to maxValue. Invalid input will generate an exception. (This function accepts minValue and maxValue as Long vs. Integer in the getValidDouble)

Parameters:
input - The actual input data to validate.
allowNull - If allowNull is true then an input that is NULL or an empty string will be legal. If allowNull is false then NULL or an empty String will throw an exception.
minValue - Lowest legal value for input.
maxValue - Highest legal value for input.
Returns:
A validated number as a double.
Throws:
Exception

                                         Set<String> validItems)
Calls getValidListItem and returns true if no exceptions are thrown.

getValidListItem

public String getValidListItem(String input,
                                         Set<String> validItems)
Confirm that the input is in the validItems list. Invalid or non-matching input will generate an exception.

Parameters:
input - The value to search 'validItems' for.
validItems - The list of valid items to search for 'input' in.
Returns:
The input String if matches to one of the items in the validItems list.
Throws:
Exception

isValidFileContent

public Boolean isValidFileContent(String input,
                                            Integer maxBytes,
                                            Boolean allowNull)
Calls getValidFileContent and returns true if no exceptions are thrown.

getValidFileContent

public String getValidFileContent(String input,
                                            Integer maxBytes,
                                            Boolean allowNull)
Returns the validated file content as a String. This is a good place to check for max file size, allowed character sets, and do virus scans. Invalid input will generate an exception. The default implementation only checks max size, and null.

Parameters:
input - The actual input data to validate.
maxBytes - The maximum number of bytes allowed in a legal file.
allowNull - If allowNull is true then an input that is NULL or an empty string will be legal. If allowNull is false then NULL or an empty String will throw an exception.
Returns:
A String containing valid file content.
Throws:
Exception

isValidPrintable

public Boolean isValidPrintable(String input,
                                          Integer maxLength,
                                          Boolean allowNull)
Calls getValidPrintable and returns true if no exceptions are thrown.

getValidPrintable

public String getValidPrintable(String input,
                                          Integer maxLength,
                                          Boolean allowNull)
Returns the input after validating it contain only printable characters. Invalid input will generate an exception.

Parameters:
input - data to be verified as printable characters
maxLength - Maximum number of bytes allowed in 'input'
allowNull - If allowNull is true then an input that is NULL or an empty string will be legal. If allowNull is false then NULL or an empty String will throw an exception.
Returns:
The input string verified to contain only printable characters
Throws:
Exception

SFDC_isValidFileName

public Boolean SFDC_isValidFileName(String input,
                                              Boolean allowNull)
Calls SFDC_getValidFileName with the default list of allowedExtensions

SFDC_isValidFileName

public Boolean SFDC_isValidFileName(String input,
                                              List<String> allowedExtensions,
                                              Boolean allowNull)
Calls SFDC_getValidFileName and returns true if no exceptions are thrown.

SFDC_getValidFileName

public String SFDC_getValidFileName(String input,
                                              Boolean allowNull)
Calls SFDC_getValidFileName with the default list of allowedExtensions

SFDC_getValidFileName

public String SFDC_getValidFileName(String input,
                                              List<String> allowedExtensions,
                                              Boolean allowNull)
Returns the input string after validating it as a valid file name. Implementors should check for allowed file extensions here, as well as allowed file name characters. Invalid input will generate an exception. Apex does not have a File object so we could not use it to verify the canonical file name. Instead we just used a RegEx pattern.

Parameters:
input - The actual input data to validate.
allowedExtensions - The extensiones you want to allow for the input file name. This is case insensitive.
allowNull - If allowNull is true then an input that is NULL or an empty string will be legal. If allowNull is false then NULL or an empty String will throw an exception.
Returns:
Input after validating it to be a valid file name
Throws:
Exception

SFDC_isValidFileUpload

public Boolean SFDC_isValidFileUpload(String filename,
                                                String content,
                                                Integer maxBytes,
                                                Boolean allowNull)
Calls SFDC_assertValidFileUpload using the default allowed file extensions and returns true if no exceptions are thrown.

SFDC_assertValidFileUpload

public void SFDC_assertValidFileUpload(String filename,
                                       String content,
                                       Integer maxBytes,
                                       List<String> allowedExtensions,
                                       Boolean allowNull)
Validates the filename, and content of a file. Invalid input will generate an exception. Does not check file path because Salesforce does not have the notion of a file path. This function internally just calls the SFDC_getValidFileName() and getValidFileContent() functions.

Parameters:
filename - The filename of the uploaded file
content - A String containing the content of the uploaded file.
maxBytes - The max number of bytes allowed for a legal file upload.
allowedExtensions - The list of allowed extensions.
allowNull - If allowNull is true then an input that is NULL or an empty string will be legal. If allowNull is false then NULL or an empty String will throw an exception.
Throws:
Exception

isValidHTTPRequestParameterSet

public Boolean isValidHTTPRequestParameterSet(PageReference request,
                                                        Set<String> required,
                                                        Set<String> optional)
Calls assertValidHTTPRequestParameterSet and returns true if no exceptions are thrown.

assertValidHTTPRequestParameterSet

public void assertValidHTTPRequestParameterSet(PageReference request,
                                               Set<String> required,
                                               Set<String> optional)
Validates that the parameters in the current (PagReference) request contain all required parameters and only optional ones in addition. Invalid input will generate an exception.

Parameters:
request - A PageReference request object to validate
required - parameters that are required to be in HTTP request
optional - additional parameters that may be in an HTTP request
Throws:
exception

SFDC_isValidRedirectLocation

public Boolean SFDC_isValidRedirectLocation(String input,
                                                      String currentDomain)
Calls SFDC_getValidRedirectLocation and returns true if no exceptions are thrown.

SFDC_isValidRedirectLocation

public Boolean SFDC_isValidRedirectLocation(String input)
Calls SFDC_getValidRedirectLocation and returns true if no exceptions are thrown.

SFDC_getValidRedirectLocation

public String SFDC_getValidRedirectLocation(String input)
Calls SFDC_getValidRedirectLocation while trying to get the current domain from ApexPages.currentPage().

SFDC_getValidRedirectLocation

public String SFDC_getValidRedirectLocation(String input,
                                                      String currentDomain)
Returns the input string after validating it is a valid redirect location string. Invalid input will generate an exception. The default validation only allows redirects to *.salesforce.com, current domain, and relative URLs. It also makes sure the URLs only allows http:// and https:// and is no longer than 512 characters long.

Note : this implementation does not protect against directory traversal.

Parameters:
input - redirect location to be validated
currentDomain - currentDomain to be used. (You should only use this if using ApexPages.CurrentPage() does not work for you) If null, will only allow relative URLS and *.salesforce.com domains.
Returns:
The input string after validating it is a valid redirect location
Throws:
Exception
